questions.title: Descriptive Essay Structure
questions.question: What is the structure of a Descriptive Essay?
paragraphs: PARAGRAPH 1 - INTRODUCTION: • Start with: "Everyone has a..." (universal hook) • Then say: "For me, that is..." (introduce your topic) • End with: Why it is important/special to you
PARAGRAPH 2 - WHAT I SEE: • Start with: "When I look at..." or "When I see..." • Describe the visual appearance • Use descriptive words for colors, shapes, sizes • Paint a picture with words
PARAGRAPH 3 - OTHER SENSES & CONNECTIONS: • Include: "I hear..." (sounds) • Include: "The smell of..." (smells) • Include feelings and textures • Describe connections with other people
PARAGRAPH 4 - PERSONAL CONNECTION: • Explain why this topic matters to you • Share what you have learned from it • Describe your feelings and emotions • Connect it to your life experiences
PARAGRAPH 5 - CONCLUSION: • Start with: "This [topic] is special because..." • Include: "It taught me that..." (lesson learned) • End with: "I will always..." (future commitment)

questions.title: Key Phrases to Remember
questions.question: What are the key phrases to use in a Descriptive Essay?
paragraphs: OPENING HOOKS (Paragraph 1): • Everyone has a... • Everyone has someone who... • Everyone knows the feeling of... • Everyone has experienced...
PERSONAL INTRODUCTION (Paragraph 1): • For me, that is... • For me, that person is... • For me, that place is... • It is special because...
VISUAL DESCRIPTIONS (Paragraph 2): • When I look at... • When I see... • When I enter... • When I watch... • I see...
SENSORY DESCRIPTIONS (Paragraph 3): • I hear... • The sound of... • The smell of... • I can feel... • It feels like...
CONCLUSION PHRASES (Paragraph 5): • [Topic] is special because... • It taught me that... • I will always... • I will never forget...

questions.title: Descriptive vs Narrative Essay
questions.question: What is the difference between Descriptive and Narrative Essay?
paragraphs: DESCRIPTIVE ESSAY: • Describes what something IS LIKE • Static - like a photograph • Uses sensory details (see, hear, smell, feel) • Focuses on appearance, qualities, characteristics • Example topics: My Best Friend, My School, My Hometown

NARRATIVE ESSAY: • Tells a story of what HAPPENED • Dynamic - like a movie • Has a plot with beginning, middle, end • Includes events in chronological order • Has a conflict/problem and resolution • Example topics: A Day When..., When I Met..., A Time I...
